Very good game I wanted all times play as H.E.C.U Marine

The first expansion to the greatest pc game that isnt Doom. It's good, has some BS factors such as the Black Ops soldiers. Bullet sponging fucks.

Would reccomend, its the best Half Life expansion.

Great story wich looks through the eyes of a soldier in half life. Its nice to view the games perspective through eyes of a enemy in half life. I hope we will see the main character of this game back in half-life 3.

The game itself is fun if you ignore everything about the fact that it's Half-Life, and play it solely for the action.
However, even that has its drawbacks.
While, yes, it was published in 1999, there are glitches within the game that are so frustratingly obvious to the developers that it makes me question as to whether or not they actually bothered to give the game a run through to find and fix these glitches.
One of the many I've encountered is just a literal 'Getting stuck' glitch. You'll get on an elevator, activate it, and the elevator simply won't move because your body has frozen in place and is stopping it from being able to, y'know, BE AN ELEVATOR.
Another is where you'll die randomly when activating certain machinery, such as the Star-Wars; A New Hope garbage compactor rip off, where upon activating it, if you try to move, you will just...Die. Out of the blue. 

The lore as well, is an absolute insult to the Half-Life series. While Half-Life: Blueshift kept promise and stayed true to the series (But was disappointingly short), Opposing Force chooses to just throw in another batch of aliens into the mix. They are used as both the main 'Opposing force' to Opposing Force. The normal Xen aliens were practically thrown out the window, and are seldom used after the first few chapters (Minus headcrabs, Zombies and five Vortigaunts). 

You'd believe that these new enemies would include the Black Mesa personnel that are terrified of being butchered by highly trained Marines who have difficulty spelling, right?

Nope.

The game has ALL of the facility staff that you meet as friendly as possible, all practically running around naked, and none of the scientists even bothering to wear a Hazardous Environment Suit (Which must have been very well available due to how many bodies of dead HEV Scientists you find within Xen) and attempting to fight you and your men. 

What could you possibly replace the HECU with as the main human enemy within this horrid game?
Black Ops.
You read that right.
Black ops.

When originally, the Black Ops had only females whose relations with the HECU were unknown; Male Black Ops were added, practically being HECU that attack the HECU. Do they work as an Antagonist? Yes, they do, very well. However it simply doesn't make sense.

The HECU are advanced trained Marines that were sent into Black Mesa as a cleanup crew; The fact that they thought that  once a group as experienced as the HECU were unable to complete their job, that instead of just sending in another HECU Team to plant a nuke and extract, that they send in Black Ops to eliminate every NON-EXTRACTED HECU within Black Mesa, alongside all scientists, security officers and Aliens (Mind you, who ultimately fail at even successfully activating the bomb without the Gmans interference) is just retarded.

All in all;
It's a 'fun' action game with frustrating glitches and a horribly written story. Even the final boss fight is horrible.
My disappointment is immeasureable and my day is ruined.

More of the halflife action you love but this time you get to play as Adrian Shepard, a soilder who is ordered to hunt down gordon freeman. The game spices things up by adding new weapons (normal and alien) and new enemies from Race X. Also I like how in this game you can have a squad of soilders follow you and aid you in fights. Doesnt contribute much to the Half Life storyline though, so in my opinion you can probably skip this if you already played HL1. But for $1 on a sale why not, its 6 hours of fun gameplay.
Best expansion pack ever released. No question to it.

Another Half-Life expansion pack, this time we play as a HECU Marine. This one is more interesting than Blue Shift, as it features new enemies, weapons, and more G-Man. The new Race X aliens are kinda hard to kill, so beware.

You play as the only character in the Half-Life universe that never got any explanation, continuation, or placed in a sequel: Adrian Shepard.

Playing from the other side of the Black Mesa incident, slip into the boots of an HECU marine. New enemies, new weapons, new locations, and experience the Half Life story once more from yet another perspective.

Best expansion for a game I've ever played. Some of the new enemies get annoying, and it's better if we not talk about the squad AI, but it's still good and packed full of interesting ideas.

One of my squad was nice enough to die and give me the SAW early. How nice of him.

Half life: Opposing Force is a expansion to the original Half Life game. You play as man named Shepard instead of the orginal Gordan. Shepard is part of the military that was trying to take down Gordon but gets caught up in the madness that happens at the 2nd half of the orginal Half life game. The expansion is great and I love that it takes place from someone else's point of view. The gameplay is the same as the original but with loads more variety in the weapons. Sound is a step up and the expansion is not that long. So if you like the orginal Half Life game, I don't see why you wouldn't like this one.

As a fan of the series I want to go into the classic throwbac kof Valves early golden days. This game is hard, confusing and doesnt act like a shooter since most of the time your low on health and get taken out by a bad ledge jump or random high class enemies.

I honestly think my copy was broken because I could never get out of one part of the level no matter what I did and my older saves vanished like dust. Only play this if you a real old school gamer fan with nothing to lose.
More Half-Life. Go for it.
Finally, a Half-Life game where the military ISN'T retarded!

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first DLC that Gearbox developed for the original Half-Life. It is seen as the better of the two DLC. It has about 12 hours of playtime and a couple of new weapons and enemies. The weapons are all very enjoyable to use, and fill more specific roles than the weapons in the base game. It's a bit of a shame that some are a bit underdeveloped. The game gets a bit tiring towards the end, with an incredibly hard sewer level and a disappointing last boss. 

[b] Pros [/b]
- Cool weapons
- New enemies
- Original levels

[b] Cons [/b]
- The centaur-infested sewers
- The room with the hanging containers
- The final boss

Half-Life: Opposing Force

This is the best add on to Half-Life in my opinion. There are new weapons and not a single crowbar. You can also create a time paradox. Race X creatures are really good enemies and the gene worm is a lot more threatening than a gargantua and a PCV suit instead of an HEV suit or an armour vest. You get to interact with other soldiers and maybe even create a small group. I really have nothing negative to say about this, everything works well. Get this if you like Half-Life series!

Half life: Opposing Force is a great expansion pack for the original Half life. The gameplay stays realtively the same, so problems with gun play still exsist. But the expansion adds in a lot of new content, like rope climbing, new weapons and new aliens. Shepard (Main character) was given a ton of new weapons Gordan Freeman never get to use, like a grappling hook, sniper rifle and a teleporting gun. There are new aliens, like pit drone, voltigore and shock troppers, and some are very fun to fight, while the last two are just annoying. Shocktropper is basically a soldier where upon death its gun becomes a headcrab. Voltigore are tanks that takes a lot to kill it and have an attack that instantly kills you, and there is a section where it is just filled with Voltigore in close quaters, that part was fustrating. Levels are less confusing then the original Half life, and I did not even use a walkthrough as I never got stuck throughout my playthrough. One major problem for me is that after defeating the final boss, the game glitched out and never teleported me to the ending. This ruined the experience as I have to type in manually the command to the end game.



Opposing force is an awesome expansion to the original Half life. It took me 4 hours to beat it, and I had a ton of fun.



Recommendation: Yes, no doubts.

Really tight game,  Almost better than the actual Half-Life 1. It follows a man called Colonel Sheperd and his adventures on the way to get out of Black Mesa. I'm not going to go deeper than that because I don't wan't to spoil the whole main storyline but just know that it is awesome.

I can't really say anything else about this. I wasn't expecting myself to like this so much, In fact I was more hyped to play Blue Shift when I first bought Half-Life: Complete. But now that I have played both, I can definetly say this one is way superior to Blue Shift.

7/10
Pretty damn good game, would reccomend to anyone who enjoys the Half Life series.
